taskDescription: Market fragmentation is the concept that all markets are increasingly diverse and comprised of smaller segments of consumers that respond differently to marketing messages. Media, too, has splintered, and in addition to having access to information provided by newspapers, magazines, TV, and radio, consumers now have access to millions of informational sources. However, severe fragmentation of both consumers and ways to communicate with them poses many challenges in marketing efficiency and branding. Why?
